page.title: 17STREET NAMES,BATH,AVON
page.content: Street names tell us a great deal about a place. {Holloway,}which means "Holy Way"is a street once used by pilgrims on their way to Glastonbury.{Southgate} and{Westgate}Streets run in the direction of the city gates (now disappeared).{Upper Borough Walls} is a street that still has remains of Bath's medieval city wall. {Beau St.}is named after the famous Beau Nash (the "King of Bath"). {Shakespeare,Milton,Kipling,Longfellow {and Shelley Avenues, }making up "{ {Poets' Corner ",}were named in honour of those famous poets. In the centre of Bath is{Hotbath St. ,where visitors once bathed in the hot springs Bath is famous for. Two famous Georgian streets were named because of their shape-the {Circus}and the{Royal Crescent.
